alright, then what we'll do is simply do some permission-magic to make it so you don't need to use sudo to throw stuff into /var/www/
The easiest way to do it is to add yourself to the www-data group (sudo adduser username www-data) and then sudo chmod g+w /var/www
You'll have to log back in for the group addition to take effect, but you'll then be able to write to /var/www as your regular user
